# Reference

<!-- DO NOT EDIT: This document was generated by Puppet Strings -->

## Table of Contents

### Classes

#### Public Classes

* [`rsyslog`](#rsyslog): Meta class to install rsyslog with a basic configuration.
You propably want rsyslog::client or rsyslog::server
* [`rsyslog::client`](#rsyslog--client): This class manages rsyslog as client
* [`rsyslog::database`](#rsyslog--database): This class manages rsyslog database connection
* [`rsyslog::params`](#rsyslog--params): Manages default configuration values for this module.
* [`rsyslog::server`](#rsyslog--server): This class manages rsyslog as server

#### Private Classes

* `rsyslog::install`: Manages rsyslog packages

### Defined types

* [`rsyslog::imfile`](#rsyslog--imfile): This class manages rsyslog file imports
* [`rsyslog::snippet`](#rsyslog--snippet): Manage rsyslog configuration snippets

## Classes

### <a name="rsyslog"></a>`rsyslog`

Meta class to install rsyslog with a basic configuration.
You propably want rsyslog::client or rsyslog::server

#### Examples

##### Puppet usage

```puppet
class { 'rsyslog': }
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `rsyslog` class:

##### <a name="-rsyslog--rsyslog_package_name"></a>`rsyslog_package_name`

Data type: `Variant[Boolean[false], String[1]]`

rsyslog package name

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::rsyslog_package_name`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--relp_package_name"></a>`relp_package_name`

Data type: `Variant[Boolean[false], String[1]]`

rsyslog relp package name

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::relp_package_name`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--mysql_package_name"></a>`mysql_package_name`

Data type: `Variant[Boolean[false], String[1]]`

rsyslog mysql package name

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::mysql_package_name`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--pgsql_package_name"></a>`pgsql_package_name`

Data type: `Variant[Boolean[false], String[1]]`

rsyslog postgresql package name

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::pgsql_package_name`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--gnutls_package_name"></a>`gnutls_package_name`

Data type: `Variant[Boolean[false], String[1]]`

rsyslog gnutls package name

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::gnutls_package_name`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--package_status"></a>`package_status`

Data type: `String[1]`

Set ensure on package resources

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::package_status`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--rsyslog_d"></a>`rsyslog_d`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Path of directory containing configuration snippets

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::rsyslog_d`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--purge_rsyslog_d"></a>`purge_rsyslog_d`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not unmanaged files in `rsyslog_d` dir should be removed

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::purge_rsyslog_d`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--rsyslog_conf"></a>`rsyslog_conf`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Path to rsyslog main configuration file

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::rsyslog_conf`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--rsyslog_conf_template_file"></a>`rsyslog_conf_template_file`

Data type: `String[1]`

Name of the rsyslog.conf template file to use

Default value: `"${module_name}/rsyslog.conf.erb"`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--rsyslog_default"></a>`rsyslog_default`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

rsyslog default file path

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::rsyslog_default`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--rsyslog_default_file"></a>`rsyslog_default_file`

Data type: `String[1]`

`rsyslog_d` file template to use

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::default_config_file`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--run_user"></a>`run_user`

Data type: `String[1]`

Which user rsyslog should run as

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::run_user`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--run_group"></a>`run_group`

Data type: `String[1]`

Which group rsyslog should run as

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::run_group`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--log_user"></a>`log_user`

Data type: `String[1]`

Which user should be used for log files and directories

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::log_user`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--log_group"></a>`log_group`

Data type: `String[1]`

Which group should be used for log files and directories

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::log_group`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--log_style"></a>`log_style`

Data type: `Enum['debian', 'freebsd', 'redhat']`

Selects the local log style in use

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::log_style`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--umask"></a>`umask`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Filemode]`

The umask parameter allows to specify the rsyslogd processesâ€™ umask

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::umask`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--perm_file"></a>`perm_file`

Data type: `Stdlib::Filemode`

File mode to use when creating new files

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::perm_file`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--perm_dir"></a>`perm_dir`

Data type: `Stdlib::Filemode`

Sets the default dirCreateMode to be used for an action if no explicit one is specified.

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::perm_dir`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--spool_dir"></a>`spool_dir`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Sets the directory that rsyslog uses for work files, e.g. imfile state or queue spool files

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::spool_dir`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--service_name"></a>`service_name`

Data type: `String[1]`

rsyslog service name

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::service_name`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--modules"></a>`modules`

Data type: `Array[String[1]]`

rsyslog modules to load

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::modules`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--preserve_fqdn"></a>`preserve_fqdn`

Data type: `Boolean`

Use full name of host even if sender and receiver are in the same domain

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::preserve_fqdn`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--local_host_name"></a>`local_host_name`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Use a custom local host name, instead of clients actual host name

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--max_message_size"></a>`max_message_size`

Data type: `String[1]`

Allows to specify maximum supported message size (both for sending and receiving)

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::max_message_size`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--system_log_rate_limit_interval"></a>`system_log_rate_limit_interval`

Data type: `Variant[String[1], Integer[0]]`

Specifies the number of seconds per rate limit interval

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::system_log_rate_limit_interval`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--system_log_rate_limit_burst"></a>`system_log_rate_limit_burst`

Data type: `Variant[String[1], Integer[0]]`

Specifies the number of messages before limiting begins

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::system_log_rate_limit_burst`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--extra_modules"></a>`extra_modules`

Data type: `Array`

Extra rsyslog modules to load

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::extra_modules`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--default_template_customisation"></a>`default_template_customisation`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

If set, this defines the `ActionFileDefaultTemplate custom formatting` which sets customisations over the default log format for remote and local logging. Must be used with actionfiletemplate to take effect

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::default_template_customisation`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--default_template"></a>`default_template`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

If set, this defines the `ActionFileDefaultTemplate` which sets the default logging format for remote and local logging

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::default_template`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--msg_reduction"></a>`msg_reduction`

Data type: `Boolean`

Reduce repeated messages

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::msg_reduction`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--non_kernel_facility"></a>`non_kernel_facility`

Data type: `Boolean`

Permit non-kernel facility messages in the kernel log

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::non_kernel_facility`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--omit_local_logging"></a>`omit_local_logging`

Data type: `Boolean`

Turn off message reception via local log socket

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::omit_local_logging`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--im_journal_ratelimit_interval"></a>`im_journal_ratelimit_interval`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[String[1], Integer[0]]]`

Specifies the interval in seconds onto which rate-limiting is to be applied

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::im_journal_ratelimit_interval`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--im_journal_statefile"></a>`im_journal_statefile`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[Stdlib::Absolutepath, String[1]]]`

This is a global setting. It specifies where the state file for persisting journal state is located

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::im_journal_statefile`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--im_journal_ratelimit_burst"></a>`im_journal_ratelimit_burst`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[String[1], Integer[0]]]`

Specifies the maximum number of messages that can be emitted within the ratelimit.interval interval

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::im_journal_ratelimit_burst`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--im_journal_ignore_previous_messages"></a>`im_journal_ignore_previous_messages`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['on', 'off']]`

This option specifies whether imjournal should ignore messages currently in journal and read only new messages

Default value: `$rsyslog::params::im_journal_ignore_previous_messages`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--rsyslog_conf_mode"></a>`rsyslog_conf_mode`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Filemode]`

Force a specific mode on the main rsyslog.conf file

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--rsyslog_d_mode"></a>`rsyslog_d_mode`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Filemode]`

Force a specific mode on the rsyslog.d directory

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--purge_ignore"></a>`purge_ignore`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[String[1], Array[String[1]]]]`

Files to exclude from purging in rsyslog.d directory

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--usrmsg_users"></a>`usrmsg_users`

Data type: `Array[String[1]]`

Array of user names that will receive emergency messages when logged

Default value: `['*']`

### <a name="rsyslog--client"></a>`rsyslog::client`

This class manages rsyslog as client

#### Examples

##### Puppet usage

```puppet
class { 'rsyslog::client': }
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `rsyslog::client` class:

* [`log_remote`](#-rsyslog--client--log_remote)
* [`spool_size`](#-rsyslog--client--spool_size)
* [`spool_timeoutenqueue`](#-rsyslog--client--spool_timeoutenqueue)
* [`remote_type`](#-rsyslog--client--remote_type)

* [`log_local_custom`](#-rsyslog--client--log_local_custom)

* [`listen_localhost`](#-rsyslog--client--listen_localhost)

* [`log_filters`](#-rsyslog--client--log_filters)

* [`imfiles`](#-rsyslog--client--imfiles)

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--log_remote"></a>`log_remote`

Data type: `Boolean`

Log remotely

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--spool_size"></a>`spool_size`

Data type: `String[1]`

Max size for disk queue if remote server fails

Default value: `'1g'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--spool_timeoutenqueue"></a>`spool_timeoutenqueue`

Data type: `Optional[Integer[0]]`

Time to wait before discarding on full spool

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--remote_type"></a>`remote_type`

Data type: `Enum['tcp', 'udp', 'relp']`

Which protocol to use for remote logging

Default value: `'tcp'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--remote_forward_format"></a>`remote_forward_format`

Data type: `String[1]`

Which forward format for remote servers should be used

Default value: `'RSYSLOG_ForwardFormat'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--log_local"></a>`log_local`

Data type: `Boolean`

Log locally

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--disable_xconsole"></a>`disable_xconsole`

Data type: `Boolean`

Disable messages to /dev/xconsole

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--log_local_custom"></a>`log_local_custom`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[Array[String[1]], String[1]]]`

Define custom local config entries

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--log_auth_local"></a>`log_auth_local`

Data type: `Boolean`

Just log auth facility locally

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--listen_localhost"></a>`listen_localhost`

Data type: `Boolean`

Start a UDP listener on 127.0.0.1:514

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--split_config"></a>`split_config`

Data type: `Boolean`

Splits the client config into 00_client_config.conf, 50_client_remote.conf and 99_client_local.conf

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--custom_config"></a>`custom_config`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Specify your own template to use for client config

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--server"></a>`server`

Data type: `Stdlib::Host`

Rsyslog server to log to

Default value: `'log'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--port"></a>`port`

Data type: `Variant[String[1], Stdlib::Port]`

Remote server port

Default value: `'514'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--remote_servers"></a>`remote_servers`

Data type: `Array[Hash]`

Array of hashes with remote servers

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--ssl"></a>`ssl`

Data type: `Boolean`

Enable SSL support

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--ssl_ca"></a>`ssl_ca`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

SSL CA file location

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--ssl_cert"></a>`ssl_cert`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Path to SSL certificate

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--ssl_key"></a>`ssl_key`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Path to SSL private key

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--ssl_permitted_peer"></a>`ssl_permitted_peer`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

List of permitted peers

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--ssl_auth_mode"></a>`ssl_auth_mode`

Data type: `String[1]`

SSL auth mode

Default value: `'anon'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--log_templates"></a>`log_templates`

Data type: `Array[Hash]`

Array of hashes defining custom logging templates using the `$template` configuration parameter

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--log_filters"></a>`log_filters`

Data type: `Array[Hash]`

Array of hashes defining custom logging filters using the `if/then` configuration parameter

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--actionfiletemplate_cust"></a>`actionfiletemplate_cust`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

If set, this defines the `ActionFileDefaultTemplate custom formatting` which sets customisations over the default log format for remote and local logging. Must be used with actionfiletemplate to take effect

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--actionfiletemplate"></a>`actionfiletemplate`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

If set, this defines the `ActionFileDefaultTemplate` which sets the default logging format for remote and local logging

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--high_precision_timestamps"></a>`high_precision_timestamps`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not to use high precision timestamps

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--client--imfiles"></a>`imfiles`

Data type: `Hash`

Specify imfile resources to create

Default value: `{}`

### <a name="rsyslog--database"></a>`rsyslog::database`

This class manages rsyslog database connection

#### Examples

##### Puppet usage

```puppet
class { 'rsyslog::database':
  backend  => 'mysql',
  server   => 'localhost',
  database => 'mydb',
  username => 'myuser',
  password => 'mypass',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `rsyslog::database` class:

* [`backend`](#-rsyslog--database--backend)
* [`server`](#-rsyslog--database--server)
* [`database`](#-rsyslog--database--database)
* [`username`](#-rsyslog--database--username)
* [`password`](#-rsyslog--database--password)

##### <a name="-rsyslog--database--backend"></a>`backend`

Data type: `Enum['mysql', 'pgsql']`

The database backend to use.

##### <a name="-rsyslog--database--server"></a>`server`

Data type: `Stdlib::Host`

The database server to use.

##### <a name="-rsyslog--database--database"></a>`database`

Data type: `String[1]`

The database name to use.

##### <a name="-rsyslog--database--username"></a>`username`

Data type: `String[1]`

The database username to use.

##### <a name="-rsyslog--database--password"></a>`password`

Data type: `Variant[String[1], Sensitive[String[1]]]`

The database password to use.

### <a name="rsyslog--params"></a>`rsyslog::params`

Manages default configuration values for this module.

### <a name="rsyslog--server"></a>`rsyslog::server`

This class manages rsyslog as server

#### Examples

##### Puppet usage

```puppet
Default usage:
  class { 'rsyslog::server': }

Create seperate directory per host
  class { 'rsyslog::server':
    custom_config => 'rsyslog/server-hostname.conf.erb'
  }
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `rsyslog::server` class:

* [`enable_tcp`](#-rsyslog--server--enable_tcp)
* [`enable_udp`](#-rsyslog--server--enable_udp)
* [`enable_relp`](#-rsyslog--server--enable_relp)
* [`remote_ruleset_tcp`](#-rsyslog--server--remote_ruleset_tcp)
* [`remote_ruleset_udp`](#-rsyslog--server--remote_ruleset_udp)
* [`remote_ruleset_relp`](#-rsyslog--server--remote_ruleset_relp)
* [`enable_onefile`](#-rsyslog--server--enable_onefile)
* [`relay_server`](#-rsyslog--server--relay_server)
* [`server_dir`](#-rsyslog--server--server_dir)
* [`custom_config`](#-rsyslog--server--custom_config)
* [`content`](#-rsyslog--server--content)
* [`port`](#-rsyslog--server--port)
* [`relp_port`](#-rsyslog--server--relp_port)
* [`address`](#-rsyslog--server--address)
* [`high_precision_timestamps`](#-rsyslog--server--high_precision_timestamps)
* [`ssl`](#-rsyslog--server--ssl)
* [`ssl_ca`](#-rsyslog--server--ssl_ca)
* [`ssl_cert`](#-rsyslog--server--ssl_cert)
* [`ssl_key`](#-rsyslog--server--ssl_key)
* [`ssl_permitted_peer`](#-rsyslog--server--ssl_permitted_peer)
* [`ssl_auth_mode`](#-rsyslog--server--ssl_auth_mode)
* [`log_templates`](#-rsyslog--server--log_templates)
* [`log_filters`](#-rsyslog--server--log_filters)
* [`actionfiletemplate_cust`](#-rsyslog--server--actionfiletemplate_cust)
* [`actionfiletemplate`](#-rsyslog--server--actionfiletemplate)
* [`rotate`](#-rsyslog--server--rotate)
* [`rules`](#-rsyslog--server--rules)

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--enable_tcp"></a>`enable_tcp`

Data type: `Boolean`

Enable TCP listener

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--enable_udp"></a>`enable_udp`

Data type: `Boolean`

Enable UDP listener

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--enable_relp"></a>`enable_relp`

Data type: `Boolean`

Enable RELP listener

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--remote_ruleset_tcp"></a>`remote_ruleset_tcp`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not the `remote` ruleset should be used for TCP listener

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--remote_ruleset_udp"></a>`remote_ruleset_udp`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not the `remote` ruleset should be used for UDP listener

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--remote_ruleset_relp"></a>`remote_ruleset_relp`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not the `remote` ruleset should be used for RELP listener

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--enable_onefile"></a>`enable_onefile`

Data type: `Boolean`

Only one logfile per remote host

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--relay_server"></a>`relay_server`

Data type: `Boolean`

If the server should be able to relay the received logs to another server. The rsyslog::client must also be set up

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--server_dir"></a>`server_dir`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Folder where logs will be stored on the server

Default value: `'/srv/log'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--custom_config"></a>`custom_config`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Specify your own template to use for rsyslog.conf

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Instead of using a template to generate rsyslog.conf, use the specified content

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--port"></a>`port`

Data type: `Variant[String[1], Stdlib::Port]`

Port to listen on for messages via TCP and UDP

Default value: `'514'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--relp_port"></a>`relp_port`

Data type: `Variant[String[1], Stdlib::Port]`

Port to listen on for messages via RELP

Default value: `'20514'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--address"></a>`address`

Data type: `String[1]`

The IP address to bind to. Applies to UDP listener only

Default value: `'*'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--high_precision_timestamps"></a>`high_precision_timestamps`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not to use high precision timestamps

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--ssl"></a>`ssl`

Data type: `Boolean`

Enable SSL support

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--ssl_ca"></a>`ssl_ca`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

SSL CA file location

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--ssl_cert"></a>`ssl_cert`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Path to SSL certificate

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--ssl_key"></a>`ssl_key`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Path to SSL private key

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--ssl_permitted_peer"></a>`ssl_permitted_peer`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

List of permitted peers

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--ssl_auth_mode"></a>`ssl_auth_mode`

Data type: `String[1]`

SSL auth mode

Default value: `'anon'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--log_templates"></a>`log_templates`

Data type: `Array[Hash]`

Array of hashes defining custom logging templates using the `$template` configuration parameter

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--log_filters"></a>`log_filters`

Data type: `Array[Hash]`

Array of hashes defining custom logging filters using the `if/then` configuration parameter

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--actionfiletemplate_cust"></a>`actionfiletemplate_cust`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

If set, this defines the `ActionFileDefaultTemplate custom formatting` which sets customisations over the default log format for remote and local logging. Must be used with actionfiletemplate to take effect

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--actionfiletemplate"></a>`actionfiletemplate`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

If set, this defines the `ActionFileDefaultTemplate` which sets the default logging format for remote and local logging

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--rotate"></a>`rotate`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['year', 'YEAR', 'month', 'MONTH', 'day', 'DAY']]`

Enables rotation of logfiles

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--server--rules"></a>`rules`

Data type: `Array[Hash]`

Array of hashes for configuring custom rules for the server. If set, this replaces the default rules

Default value: `[]`

## Defined types

### <a name="rsyslog--imfile"></a>`rsyslog::imfile`

This class manages rsyslog file imports

#### Examples

##### Puppet usage

```puppet
rsyslog::imfile { 'my-imfile':
  file_name     => '/some/file',
  file_tag      => 'mytag',
  file_facility => 'local0',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `rsyslog::imfile` defined type:

* [`file_name`](#-rsyslog--imfile--file_name)
* [`file_tag`](#-rsyslog--imfile--file_tag)
* [`file_facility`](#-rsyslog--imfile--file_facility)
* [`file_readmode`](#-rsyslog--imfile--file_readmode)
* [`ensure`](#-rsyslog--imfile--ensure)
* [`polling_interval`](#-rsyslog--imfile--polling_interval)
* [`file_severity`](#-rsyslog--imfile--file_severity)
* [`persist_state_interval`](#-rsyslog--imfile--persist_state_interval)
* [`imfile_template`](#-rsyslog--imfile--imfile_template)

##### <a name="-rsyslog--imfile--file_name"></a>`file_name`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

The file being monitored.

##### <a name="-rsyslog--imfile--file_tag"></a>`file_tag`

Data type: `String[1]`

The tag to be assigned to messages read from this file.

##### <a name="-rsyslog--imfile--file_facility"></a>`file_facility`

Data type: `Stdlib::Syslogfacility`

The syslog facility to be assigned to messages read from this file.

##### <a name="-rsyslog--imfile--file_readmode"></a>`file_readmode`

Data type: `Optional[Integer[0,2]]`

This provides support for processing some standard types of multiline messages.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--imfile--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present', 'absent']`

Set ensure on resource

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--imfile--polling_interval"></a>`polling_interval`

Data type: `Integer[0]`

This setting specifies how often files are to be polled for new data.

Default value: `10`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--imfile--file_severity"></a>`file_severity`

Data type: `Variant[Integer[0,23], String[1]]`

The syslog severity to be assigned to lines read.

Default value: `'notice'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--imfile--persist_state_interval"></a>`persist_state_interval`

Data type: `Integer[0]`

Specifies how often the state file shall be written when processing the input file.

Default value: `0`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--imfile--imfile_template"></a>`imfile_template`

Data type: `String[1]`

Config file template to use.

Default value: `'rsyslog/imfile.erb'`

### <a name="rsyslog--snippet"></a>`rsyslog::snippet`

Manage rsyslog configuration snippets

#### Examples

##### Puppet usage

```puppet
rsyslog::snippet { 'my-rsyslog-config':
  content => '<Some rsyslog directive>',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `rsyslog::snippet` defined type:

* [`content`](#-rsyslog--snippet--content)
* [`ensure`](#-rsyslog--snippet--ensure)
* [`file_mode`](#-rsyslog--snippet--file_mode)
* [`source`](#-rsyslog--snippet--source)

##### <a name="-rsyslog--snippet--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

The actual content to place in the file

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--snippet--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present', 'file', 'absent']`

Set ensure for the resource

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--snippet--file_mode"></a>`file_mode`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Filemode]`

The mode of the file snippet

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-rsyslog--snippet--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`



Default value: `undef`
